title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.34 | 02-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The session begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: On the battlefield where Shri Krishna attended Arjuna out of friendship, the flowing hair of Lord Krishna turned ashen due to the dust raised by the hooves of the horses.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.9.34) describing Bhishma's remembrance of Krishna on the battlefield, focusing on Krishna's appearance and the arrows striking Him.

segments.key_quote: So, that is the difficult part to understand for a common man. Therefore, we have to hear such descriptions from the lips of a pure devotee who will explain perfectly how to understand these dealings between the lord and his devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Bhishma's transcendental relationship (Virya Rasa) with Krishna, emphasizing that Krishna's transcendental body cannot be harmed and that understanding these concepts requires hearing from pure devotees.

segments.key_quote: The lord is the absolute form of eternity, bliss and knowledge.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's nature as eternal, full of bliss and knowledge, and discusses the five primary relationships (rasas) with Krishna: shanta, dasya, sakya, vatsalya, and madhurya.

segments.key_quote: Thus his throwing of sharp arrows at the transcendental body of the lord is as good as the worship of another devotee who throws soft roses upon him
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Bhishma's actions, though seemingly harmful, are a form of worship, and that Krishna's body is not pained due to its transcendental nature.

segments.key_quote: This material body is not our identity... we are eternally devotee of Krishna in the spiritual form
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the material body with the spiritual form, emphasizing that our true identity is as eternal devotees of Krishna, not as the temporary material body.

segments.key_quote: Spirit is never pierced, burnt, dried, moistened etc... spirit is always uncontaminated and indestructible
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the spiritual form is indestructible, uncontaminated by matter, and eternal, referencing the Bhagavad Gita and Skanda Purana.

segments.key_quote: Lord Vishnu in his incarnation appears before us, he seems to be like one of the conditioned souls... just to bewilder the asuras
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how Krishna appears to be like a conditioned soul to bewilder non-believers (asuras) who try to harm Him, emphasizing that the Lord is completely spiritual and cannot be killed.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva appreciated the all-merciful attitude of the lord because he did not leave Arjuna alone
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by explaining how non-devotees are bewildered by Bhishma's actions, while devotees understand the pure devotion and kindness in the relationship between Bhishma and Krishna, ending with gratitude and Hare Krishna.
